intro: Brewcaria marahuacae, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant has opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces a milky sap that is toxic to some animals, including insects and mammals. Brewcaria marahuacae thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
